name: Paul Lobel
biography: Jewelry designer and artist. Studied commercial art at Pratt Institute, Brooklyn. Collaborated with Leo J. Uris on decorative sculpture and accessories between 1928-34. Designed glass objects for Regal Art Glass Company and silver objects for the International Silver Company. In 1944 opened a studio/shop in New York City. Began experimenting with plastics in the 1960s, closing his shop in 1965 to work with the medium exclusively. Began working with paper in the 1970s.
